q: How do flood barriers compare to sandbags?
a: Barriers deploy faster, form airtight seals, and can be reused. Sandbags leak, require disposal, and introduce contaminated waste. One 6-ft barrier replaces over 150 sandbags. See Modular Flood Barrier.
Initially yes, but disposal and labor make them more expensive after two storms. Barriers pay for themselves within two flood events.

q: Do sandbags provide the same protection height?
a: No—standard stacks protect only 12–18 inches. Engineered barriers protect 24–48 inches or more, with verified hydrostatic ratings.

q: Can barriers and sandbags be used together?
a: Yes—sandbags can divert runoff toward barrier edges on uneven ground, but barriers remain the primary defense.

q: Which option is better for long-term mitigation?
a: Reusable barriers—cleaner, faster, and accepted by FEMA as dry-floodproofing equipment. Sandbags are for emergencies only.
